qas.question: When did the Habsburgs  sell the Sundgau territory to France?
How much did France pay for Sundgau?
In 1685 Edict Fontainebleau by way of the French King ordered what to be done?
When did the Spanish conquer Alsace?
How much did the Habsburgs buy Sundgau for?
When was the University of Strasbourg founded?
What was the name of the treaty between the French and the Germans?

context: This situation prevailed until <b3_0>1639<b3_0/>, when most of Alsace was conquered by France so as to keep it out of the hands of the Spanish Habsburgs, who wanted a clear road to their valuable and rebellious possessions in the Spanish Netherlands. Beset by enemies and seeking to gain a free hand in Hungary, the Habsburgs sold their Sundgau territory (mostly in Upper Alsace) to France in <a0_0>1646<a0_0/>, which had occupied it, for the sum of <a1_0><b4_0>1.2 million Thalers<b4_0/><a1_0/>. When hostilities were concluded in 1648 with <b6_0>the Treaty of Westphalia<b6_0/>, most of Alsace was recognized as part of France, although some towns remained independent. The treaty stipulations regarding Alsace were complex; although the French king gained sovereignty, existing rights and customs of the inhabitants were largely preserved. France continued to maintain its customs border along the Vosges mountains where it had been, leaving Alsace more economically oriented to neighbouring German-speaking lands. The German language remained in use in local administration, in schools, and at the (Lutheran) University of Strasbourg, which continued to draw students from other German-speaking lands. The <b5_0>1685<b5_0/> Edict of Fontainebleau, by which the French king ordered <a2_0>the suppression of French Protestantism<a2_0/>, was not applied in Alsace. France did endeavour to promote Catholicism; Strasbourg Cathedral, for example, which had been Lutheran from <b7_0>1524<b7_0/> to 1681, was returned to the Catholic Church. However, compared to the rest of France, Alsace enjoyed a climate of religious tolerance.
